intro: Brachystephanus congensis subsp. congensis, commonly known as the Congo stephanus, is a flowering plant native to Central Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Its leaves are opposite and elliptical, with a glossy surface. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that attract various pollinators.
